info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 02 at 2:32AM CDT until August 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heat index values up to 105 expected. * WHERE...In Kansas, Decatur, Norton, Sheridan and Graham Counties. In Nebraska, Hitchcock and Red Willow Counties. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 8 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Increased likelihood of heat related illness.
info.instruction: Heat is one of the leading weather-related killers in the United States, resulting in hundreds of fatalities each year. If possible, re-schedule outdoor activities to the early morning or evening hours. If you must be outdoors, wear light weight and loose fitting clothing, drink plenty of water, and take frequent breaks in the shade or an air conditioned building. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Symptoms of heat exhaustion include heavy sweating, paleness, muscle cramps, weakness, dizziness, headache, nausea, vomiting, and fainting. Seek medical help if symptoms get worse or last for more than an hour. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
